data.title: "generate package" not available in Command Palette
data.body:
I'm trying the `generate package` command described in the [Create your first package docs](https://atom.io/docs/latest/your-first-package), but it's not in there (version 0.137.0)/doesn't show up in the Command Palette.

It is, however, available from the top menu under Packages > Package Generator.

data.title: Selected text after pasting
data.body: This way I could indent the block I just pasted

data.title: Config can't be loaded
data.body:
After the update of Atom to 0.137.0 everything worked well. Then i changed a setting in the SettingsView and after the next start i got this error:

![bildschirmfoto 2014-10-17 um 16 15 48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5446019/4680123/3a6ec48a-5608-11e4-82a2-188cd3a2020c.png)

Currently every time when i start atom the default config is getting loaded and the welcome.md file appears.

Verified:
- In safe mode i have the same problem.
- [~/.atom/config.cson](https://gist.github.com/philipgiuliani/bb45800923129a66bf29) is present, and has 777 chmod.

/cc @benogle because you worked on settings recently :)

data.title: Editor freezes when opening folder
data.body:
I have a folder containing a large number of files/directories. Whenever I open it on a mac the editor v0.137.0 freezes. I can open any of the sub directories fine.
Is there a way to clear all cached information related to the folder when opening?

data.title: Refused to evaluate a string as JavaScript because 'unsafe-eval' is not an allowed source of script in the following Content Security Policy directive: "script-src 'self'".
data.body:
Since Atom 0.137 (On OSX 10.10) I see this when I try to upgrade, edit the settings or view a package.

![screenshot 2014-10-17 01 08 54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4365/4674681/4fc1e9a2-559a-11e4-9ccf-d89fb55309de.png)

I've run atom --safe and the same error appears.

data.title: Fonts are a bit blurred compared to other editors
data.body:
I am using Windows 8.1 and I always use Consolas fonts for source code.
Antialiasing seems to not working for atom, so if I compare how the fonts are look like with
other editors there is a difference against atom. To see the difference put next to each other a code
opened with Eclipse or Intellj with code open with atom. Even Gvim looks better. This is a major drawback.

data.title: [OSX] Erroneously clicking on Atom icon in dock multiple times freezes app and launches several instances
data.body:
If Atom is closed completely and its dock icon clicked multiple times before the editor has time to render, the application takes a long time to load and several windows are spawned (based on the number of clicks). I noticed this when erroneously double-clicking the icon to launch.

Tested on OSX Mavericks and Yosemite.

data.title: Fix selecting past the last line
data.body:
Continuation of #3556

Fixes #3527

data.title: problem with classlist polyfill
data.body:
I don't know if things should be reported that only happen once.  To quote a friend of mine, "once a fluke, twice a bug".

Anyway, FWIW, eli grey's classlist polyfill threw this error ..

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'ended' of null 
head.built.js:1717
```

It also just occurred to me, should I report things to atom/atom when thrown in dependencies like this?

data.title: Opt out of command registration for textInput events
data.body:
There seems to be issues capturing them when they are programmatically
dispatched via dispatchEvent. This was causing problems for the vim-mode
specs. This event belongs among the native events that aren’t treated
as commands anyway.

data.title: Package load failure breaks developer mode and spec runner
data.body:
Not sure if this is an atom-shell issue or not, but reporting it for the time being; both running Atom in developer mode (`atom --dev`) as well as running specs is broken on OS X.

Attempting to execute the core Atom specs via `apm test` results in the following failure:

```
europa:atom thomasjo$ apm test
[26080:1017/000411:INFO:renderer_main.cc(204)] Renderer process started
2014-10-17 00:04:11.268 Atom[26078:507] Could not get code signature for running application, application updates are disabled: Error Domain=NSOSStatusErrorDomain Code=-67062 "The operation couldn’t be completed. (OSStatus error -67062.)"
[26078:1017/000412:INFO:CONSOLE(27)] "Error: ENOENT, no such file or directory '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/exports/atom.coffee'
  at Error (native)
  at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:455:18)
  at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/common/lib/asar.js:422:20)
  at Object.fs.readFileSync (fs.js:313:15)
  at Object.fs.readFileSync (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/common/lib/asar.js:329:27)
  at Object.requireCoffeeScript [as .coffee] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/coffee-cache.js:58:17)
  at Module.load (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:318:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:373:17)

  at Module._compile (module.js:468:26)
  at Object.requireCoffeeScript [as .coffee] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/coffee-cache.js:61:19)
  at Module.load (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:318:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:373:17)
  at require (module.js:392:17)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/spec/spec-suite.coffee:4:1)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/spec/spec-suite.coffee:1:1)
  at Module._compile (module.js:468:26)
  at Object.requireCoffeeScript [as .coffee] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/coffee-cache.js:61:19)
  at Module.load (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)

  at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/spec/spec-bootstrap.coffee:24:3)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/spec/spec-bootstrap.coffee:2:1)
  at Module._compile (module.js:468:26)
  at Object.requireCoffeeScript [as .coffee] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/coffee-cache.js:61:19)
  at Module.load (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)

", source: /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/spec/spec-bootstrap.coffee (27)
Tests failed
```

Similarly, when opening Atom in dev mode (almost) all packages fail to load, with nearly identical errors:

```
Failed to activate package named 'update-package-dependencies' Error: ENOENT, no such file or directory '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/exports/atom.coffee'
  at Error (native)
  at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:455:18)
  at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/common/lib/asar.js:422:20)
  at Object.fs.readFileSync (fs.js:313:15)
  at Object.fs.readFileSync (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/common/lib/asar.js:329:27)
  at Object.requireCoffeeScript [as .coffee] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/coffee-cache.js:58:17)
  at Module.load (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:318:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:373:17)
  at require (module.js:392:17)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/update-package-dependencies/lib/update-package-dependencies.js:4:10)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/update-package-dependencies/lib/update-package-dependencies.js:70:4)
  at Module._compile (module.js:468:26)
  at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:486:10)
  at Module.load (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:318:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:373:17)
  at require (module.js:392:17)
  at Package.module.exports.Package.requireMainModule (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:539:34)
  at Package.module.exports.Package.activateConfig (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:214:12)
  at Package.module.exports.Package.activateNow (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:196:14)
  at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:185:28
  at Package.module.exports.Package.measure (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:131:15)
  at Package.module.exports.Package.activate (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:179:14)
  at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.activatePackage (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package-manager.js:404:21)
  at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.activatePackages (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package-manager.js:393:14)
  at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.activate (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package-manager.js:379:19)
  at Atom.module.exports.Atom.startEditorWindow (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom.js:516:21)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:12:8)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:23:4)
  at Module._compile (module.js:468:26)

```

This happens against the latest bits in `master` branch, on both OS X 10.10 (Yosemite Beta 6) and OS X 10.9.5 (Mavericks).

data.title: Create Your First Package tutorial fixes
data.body:
When following this tutorial, I had some problems in the "Add a Key Binding" section:
1. It told me to put `atom-text-editor` on the first line, which does not work. However, using `.workspace` works, so I have changed the tutorial to say this instead.
2. It told me in a paragraph to enter `ctrl-alt-a`, but the example text read `cmd-alt-a` instead. Further, some people reported problems with the `alt` key when using international keyboards (atom/atom-keymap#35). Thus, I changed the key binding to `ctrl-i`.
3. It told me that deleting the existing key binding will leave me with a two-line file, which is not true because of the default comments at the top of the file. I therefore changed the wording slightly.

data.title: Atom file association in windows after updating
data.body:
After updating (with cup), when I start atom directly I get the 0.137 version, but if I double click a file 0.136 opens up (if no other instance is already open).

Since the old binary is still in place all the file associations I added (for example .c, .cpp, .lua) will still open with that. 

Is there a way to let the chocolately package find all already present file associations for atom and update them with the new path?

data.title: Portuguese Keyboard events not working
data.body:
Hi there,

I've got a Portuguese Keyboard Layout and it seems this is not working right in Atom.

Certain important shortcuts don't work, I have verified what is happening with the keybindings and Atom is not recognising most of my typing combinations.

Has this issue been addressed?

Thanks

data.title: Join lines with a single space
data.body:
Removing trailing whitespace from the current line and leading whitespace from the line below when joining and put the cursor to the left of the added space to make adding things like a `,` easy.

Continuation of #3739 

Fixes #3439

data.title: Alt-Hotkey ampersands show up when menu is opened the first time
data.body:
When I open the menu for the first time, there are ampersands ("&") in from of shortcut characters. When I hover away and back again, they disappear:

![d53ly](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11575/4666603/0a9f0ea8-5555-11e4-9ff6-26e9b11c5e81.gif)

(Sorry for the crappy GIF that looks like it is the other way around and the ampersands appear only after hovering away and back again.)

data.title: alt-cmd-[ / ] for out and indenting not working after update
data.body:
workaround -> in keymap file
# WORKAROUND

  atom-text-editor:not(.mini)':
    'alt-cmd-5': 'editor:outdent-selected-rows'
    'alt-cmd-6': 'editor:indent-selected-rows'

data.title: atom.project.scan bug, can not find results
data.body:
![2014-10-16 7 56 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/704762/4662040/ccc13760-552b-11e4-9c6e-991dc30b7792.png)

After report bug in: https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/292#issuecomment-59181001, 
I found it is the issue of `atom.project.scan`.

I read the source code of package `find-and-replace`, found that `atom.project.scan` did not return the search all results. And I run this command in `Developer Tools`:
![2014-10-16 7 57 43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/704762/4662046/e1bb5b6e-552b-11e4-9e5d-f75bd4af9d62.png)

data.title: Atom 0.137.0: appmenu / global menu no longer works under Ubuntu 14.10
data.body:
The Atom appmenu / global menu no longer works with Atom 0.137.0 in Ubuntu 14.10 (with Unity): http://i.imgur.com/1TSYnD5.png

It used to work up until this version and also, Ubuntu 14.10 seems to be the only one affected as I've tested it in Ubuntu 14.04 and it still works there.

Tested with both the Atom deb downloaded from GitHub and with Atom from the WebUpd8 Atom PPA.

data.title: Build on Windows, stuck at set-version task
data.body:
Hi guys,

I haven't rebuilt since v131 I believe.
When I tried today, I find that the build process does not finish. It just sits there after the set-version task has started and never goes any further:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/4660761/997835c6-551b-11e4-9d05-7c3ebd0bdf8a.png)

I have tried waiting for 2 hours, nothing changes. 
I also always do a `script/clean` before `script/build`.

Win8, 64bit.

Any ideas what could be hanging here?

data.title: Tab key broken in editor
data.body:
Tested on latest version in master.

Tab is broken in the editor.

Using the command selector to manually execute `editor:indent` does work.

data.title: @-sign on Windows, German Keyboard
data.body:
Tried to make an [at] sign in editor, it doesnt work. No error, no Console logs.
[AT]- sign on Windows with German Keyboard is "[alt gr] + Q"

data.title: Doesn't work copy paste at 0.137.0 for mac
data.body:
I've tried to copy code and:

```
Uncaught Error: No screen line exists when converting buffer row to screen row /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/history.js:99
```
